name: chicagotribune
text: Can architects help Mayor Lightfoot rewrite Chicago’s depressing, Dickensian “tale of two cities” narrative? We're about to find out, writes critic @BlairKamin. https://t.co/2wLpj32hI2

name: chicagotribune
text: Mayor Lightfoot did what she had to do by removing the Christopher Columbus statue from Grant Park, but it still hurts, writes columnist @John_Kass. https://t.co/06kAB7hJBR

name: chicagotribune
text: President Trump’s rhetoric about Joe Biden's housing plan is a blatant attempt to frighten homeowners with the prospect of people of color moving in, writes columnist @SteveChapman13. https://t.co/zFkI4Epc4M

name: chicagotribune
text: A man dug up a World War II artillery shell in his Brighton Park backyard and called police, who sent out explosives experts to investigate and then destroy it. https://t.co/kwG0zc185Y
